title: 105_hr2367
content: The Act titled "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 1997" refers to amendments and repeals in terms of provisions of title 38, United States Code. Section 2 addresses disability compensation. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 1997" increases rates for various subsections in Section 1114 of title 38, United States Code. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 1997" increases rates for various subsections in Section 1114 of title 38, United States Code. The amendments include adjustments to dollar amounts in different subsections, such as increasing from $1,181 to $1,964, $2,443 to $3,426, and $2,768 to $3,066, among others. The Act "Veterans' Compensation Rate Amendments of 1997" increases rates for various subsections in Section 1114 of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may authorize increases in disability compensation rates for certain individuals. SEC. 3. Additional compensation for dependents is increased in various clauses. SEC. 4. Clothing allowance for certain disabled veterans is also increased. SEC. 5. Dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. SEC. 5. Dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses is increased to $850 and $185 for new law rates, and adjustments are made to the table for old law rates. The monthly pay rates for different pay grades range from $850 to $2,811. The surviving spouse's rate varies based on the veteran's rank, ranging from $1,044 to $2,811. The surviving spouse's rate is designated by section 402 of this title and shall be $1,941. Section 1311 of the Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC) for Children is amended to increase the additional DIC for children to $215 each. Additionally, the Aid and Attendance Allowance is raised to $215, and the Housebound Rate is increased to $104. SEC. 6. Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Children is amended to increase benefits for orphan children and disabled adult children. The changes include raising the DIC amounts for orphan children to $361, $520, $675, and $675/$132, and for disabled adult children to $215, $361, and $182. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on December 1, 1997.
